headline: Compared to Estimates, Constellation Brands (STZ) Q2 Earnings: A Look at Key Metrics
summary: While the top- and bottom-line numbers for Constellation Brands (STZ) give a sense of how the business performed in the quarter ended August 2025, it could be worth looking at how some of its key metrics compare to Wall Street estimates and year-ago values.

headline: Constellation Brands (STZ) Beats Q2 Earnings and Revenue Estimates
summary: Constellation Brands (STZ) delivered earnings and revenue surprises of +7.72% and +0.98%, respectively, for the quarter ended August 2025. Do the numbers hold clues to what lies ahead for the stock?

headline: Constellation Lowers Outlook Again as Pullback Among Hispanic Consumers Continues
summary: Constellation Brands  posted lower second-quarter sales and lowered its full-year earnings outlook again as its core Hispanic demographic continues to buy less beer amid the Trump administration’s immigration crackdown.  It reiterated its previous adjusted earnings forecast of $11.30 to $11.60 a share.  Constellation had already cut its full-year guidance last month, saying consumers, and in particular Hispanics, were making fewer shopping trips and tightening their spending.

headline: Constellation Brands (NYSE:STZ) Beats Q3 Sales Expectations
summary: Beer, wine, and spirits company Constellation Brands (NYSE:STZ) reported Q3 CY2025 results exceeding the market’s revenue expectations, but sales fell by 15% year on year to $2.48 billion. Its non-GAAP profit of $3.63 per share was 6.5% above analysts’ consensus estimates.

headline: Constellation Brands shares rise 3% in pre-market after quarterly earnings beat

headline: How Recent Developments Are Shaping the Constellation Brands Investment Story
summary: Constellation Brands stock has seen its consensus analyst price target decrease from $179.78 to $176.09, reflecting a modest reduction in perceived fair value. This adjustment follows recent downward revisions to the company's FY26 outlook. The revisions are driven by ongoing challenges in beer demand and inventory management. As analyst perspectives on the company shift, investors should stay alert for further updates to understand how the evolving narrative might shape future opportunities...

headline: Stocks, Gold, Bitcoin Are Soaring. This Could Reverse the Market Rally and 5 More Things to Know Today.
summary: The S&P 500 is on a six-day winning streak, which includes every trading day of the shutdown and the three sessions building up to it.  The index hasn’t climbed for seven straight days since early May. Gold and Bitcoin have also been surging, with both hitting record highs.  Unfortunately, anything that dents that confidence is likely to also hurt a stock market trading at record highs.

headline: Constellation Stock Is Struggling. Earnings May Not Be Enough to Turn Things Around.
summary: Shares of the U.S. distributor of Corona and Modelo beers have been swirling the drain—and so have sales.  Constellation Brands  will report fiscal second-quarter earnings on Monday after the market close.  For the three months ended in August, analysts polled by FactSet expect the company to report earnings of $3.38 per share, down 28% from a year ago.
